    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.util.concurrent.CyclicBarrier barrier 
      (package private) long[] barrierSeeds
      Runs two de-serialized Networks in lock-step using a CyclicBarrier, checking that their RNG seeds are exactly the same after each compute cycle - which guarantees that the output of both Networks is the same (the RNGs must be called exactly the same amount of times for this to be true).

      • testSerializedUnStartedNetworkRuns_DateEncoder

        public void testSerializedUnStartedNetworkRuns_DateEncoder()
        The DateEncoder presents a special challenge because its main field (the DateFormatter) is not serializable and requires its state (format) to be saved and re-installed following de-serialization.

      • testDeserializedInstancesRunExactlyTheSame

        public void testDeserializedInstancesRunExactlyTheSame()

      • testRunSerializedNetworkWithFileSensor

        public void testRunSerializedNetworkWithFileSensor()
        Ensure that a Network run uninterrupted will have the same output as a Network that has been halted; serialized, and restarted! This test runs a Network all the way through, recording 10 outputs between set indexes. Then runs a second Network, stopping in the middle of those indexes and serializing the Network. Then de-serializes that Network, and continues on - both pre and post serialized Networks record the same indexes as the first Network that ran all the way through. The outputs of both Networks from the start to finish indexes are compared and tested that they are exactly the same.

      • testStoreAndLoad_FileSensor

        public void testStoreAndLoad_FileSensor()
        Tests the Network Serialization API

      • testStoreAndLoad_ObservableSensor

        public void testStoreAndLoad_ObservableSensor()
        This test stops and starts a Network which has a Publisher - which is not the way it would be done in production as you could just stop entering data, and continue again as desired. The user controls the data flow when using a Publisher.
